block.p: Security was no problem at the New York City Police Foundation's annual winter dinner-dance Thursday. The party, at Police Headquarters, honored John F. McGillicuddy, chairman of Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company. The evening benefited the foundation's fund for special programs.
Later Thursday, the American Museum of Natural History gave a dinner dance in the Hall of Ocean Life to raise money for the museum's 1992 exhibition on global warming.

Later Thursday, the American Museum of Natural History gave a dinner dance in the Hall of Ocean Life to raise money for the museum's 1992 exhibition on global warming.
Wednesday, the Metropolitan Club held a Founder's Ball celebrating its centennial year in its refurbished white marble building at Fifth Avenue and 60th Street.
Also Wednesday, the trustees of the Whitney Museum of American Art gave a dinner to celebrate and preview "The Drawings of Jasper Johns."
Earlier Wednesday the New York Fashion Industry gave a benefit cocktail party at the restaurant Remi to raise money for Citymeals-on-Wheels.

The Mark Morris Dance Group benefited Tuesday from a fashion show by Andre Courreges in the lobby of the Paramount Hotel. Marvin S. Traub, chairman of Bloomingdale's, and Anna Wintour, editor of Vogue, were the hosts.
